Online talks

14 Apr 2020

Many things have gone online, including talks and conferences. A small post with pointers.

Online seminars

Many seminars have moved to online settings.

  • Terence Tao has a list of list of online maths seminars, including Online maths seminars that has more than 15 talks per day (in all kinds of mathematics).

  • The same thing but speciafically for TCS can be found here. (One or two talks per day.)

  • Aalto university also has its seminar (that is not listed (yet?) in the lists above).

  • The online TCS seminar, TCS+ has increased its frequency from one per month to one per week (and all the previous talks are available).

  • The Simons Institute also has a lot of good videos, see here.

Online courses

Many universities have MOOCs, or at least videos of some classes.

  • Jukka Suomela has just started a new iteration of his parallel programming class, and this year of course everything is online. The videos are here.

  • MIT has, for example, videos lectures about lower bounds, and advanced data structures

Online conferences

Conferences that were suppose to take place this spring or this summer decide one by one to held virtually. This is the case of ICALP and STOC for example.

The ACM issued a guide on how to organize such online conferences. The pdf is here.
